category.term: 0~MTV Networks Company~Florence and the Machine~Jamie Campbell Bower~Kanye West
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Twilight soundtrack alumni Florence + The Machine have hired one of the movie saga's nastiest vampires, Volturi Jamie Campbell Bower, for their latest music video, “Never Let Me Go,” and yet it's Flo who seems capable of some supernatural violence in the new clip.

Granted, the sheer force of Florence Welch's pipes have always been more bad-ass than any of Stephenie Meyer's sparklevamps. Flo's not some pushover who glistens in an enchanted meadow! (Well, not anymore, anyway. That was for the last album cycle.) In this Tabitha Denholm-directed video, Welch is the sort of gal who busts into skating rinks after hours with her skid boyfriend (Campbell Bower)! The kind of gal who dyes her hair by summoning dark, demonic spirits -- ones who ooze out of her pores, and various plumbing fixtures, until she's nothing but a black-haired creepy mist.

(At least we think that's what's happening in the latter portion of the video. How else to explain why she's gone and switched her signature red mane for raven?)

"Never Let Me Go" gets a proper single release April 2, though the band's website notes it's already available on iTunes. They'll be following it with a full record release soon, though, as earlier this week it was announced that a recording of their MTV Unplugged set will reach stores April 9.

Welch discussed her Unplugged episode with MTV recently. (The December taping featured covers of Johnny Cash and June Carter's "Jackson," which she sang with Queens of the Stone Age's Josh Homme, and Otis Redding's "Try a Little Tenderness.") Apparently Kanye West, who sampled that last track on Watch the Throne's "Otis," was in the front row for the performance.

"He was dancing and really going for it in the front row; it was amazing," Welch said. "At award shows, you can't really see anyone, because there's lights, and they're kind of far away, but for this, it was just like Kanye was just there. And I covered 'Try a Little Tenderness,' and he'd just sampled that for the Watch the Throne album, so I was like, 'Um, Hi ... you kind of got there before me, but I'm going to do this now, and it's kind of for you ...' He was smiling the whole way through, and I think he's a total genius, so to have him there was really incredible."

Watch "Never Let Me Go" below:

leahc@dose.ca

source.title: Florence + The Machine Out-Creep Twilight Actor in New Video "Never Let Me Go"
source.subtitle: Florence Welch dyed her hair black? The devil -- or some sort of gooey demon -- made her do it.

entry.title: Photos: 2012 BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: If you want photos of Adele looking adorable, you've come to the right place. The 2012 BRIT Awards went down in London Feb. 21. The show airs in Canada on MuchMusic, Feb. 21 at 8 p.m. Check out some of the highlights, with these pics of Rihanna, Coldplay, Kylie Minogue, Florence and the Machine and more.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
Adele offers a comedic "gesture" to the camera after being cut off in the middle of her acceptance speech. The biggest pop star in the world -- we repeat, the biggest pop star in the world -- was interrupted while accepting the BRIT Award for album of the year.
Adele: "You're going to cut me off?"
Host, James Corden: "I'm so sorry."
Adele: "Can I just say, then, goodbye and I'll see you next time 'round, yeah?" (Flips her middle finger.)
link.title: Adele offers a comedic "gesture" to the camera after being cut off in the middle of her acceptance speech.

link.Abstract: The stars are across the pond celebrated music's big night at the 2012 BRIT Awards on Feb. 21, 2012. Check out the fashion winners and losers, and vote for your favourite looks!
link.title: Rate the Fashion: The 2012 Brit Awards
